page.title: 01Merebrow and Holmes.
page.content: The area we are studying is situated in the S.W. Lancashire Plain ; equal distant between the seaside town of Southport and the industrial town of Preston. The inhabited areas in the block are of two types. A thriving village of Merebrow with some modern housing. A hamlet of Holmes with one lane with Market Gardens bordering it and farms scattered. The area is dissected by a dual carriageway opened in 1945. West. of the area is exposed and used for grazing and cultivation. The rest of the area is intensively cultivated , including cover of approx 15 acres of glasshouses . To the S.W. is a Leisure area created from old sand excavations . This area is all part of the parish of Tarleton pop approx 4,500.
